events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan request aimed at covering medical expenses accumulated over recent months.
The application was categorised under Personal Loan due to the mention of medical treatment and no other relevant loan purposes.
A loan officer was assigned to the file to begin processing and to establish communication with the applicant.
During the initial review, the officer confirmed that the applicant's credit history appears clean but requires further documentation.
The applicant was requested to provide medical bills, proof of income, and identification to support the personal loan application.
Applicant submitted all requested documents, including detailed medical invoices and updated employment verification letters.
Credit check completed showing a good credit score with no late payments or default history, supporting loan approval prospects.
Risk assessment marked the applicant as moderate risk primarily due to outstanding medical debts; further evaluation pending.
A loan offer was presented to the applicant with terms, repayment schedule, and interest rates tailored for personal medical expenses.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer and requested minor clarification on the repayment method proposed.
The application was escalated to senior management to consider a slight adjustment to interest due to applicant’s feedback.
Senior management approved the loan application with adjusted terms, recognizing the applicant’s valid medical need.
Loan funds were disbursed to the applicant’s bank account in full as per the approved terms and schedule.
Follow-up conducted to ensure the applicant received funds and to offer support for repayment planning if required.
Loan application case was officially closed after successful funding and post-approval follow-up completion.
